title: The Adventure of the Final Problem

sentences.text: The Adventure of the Final Problem
It is with a heavy heart that I take up my pen to write these the last words in which I shall ever record the singular gifts by which my friend Mr Sherlock Holmes was distinguished.

In an incoherent and, as I deeply feel, an entirely inadequate fashion, I have endeavoured to give some account of my strange experiences in his company from the chance which first brought us together at the period of the 'Study in Scarlet', up to the time of his interference in the matter of the 'Naval Treaty' - an interference which had the unquestionable effect of preventing a serious international complication.

concepts.comment: "Study in Scarlet" is a journal record name;
"Naval Treaty" is a journal record name;

sentences.text: It was my intention to have stopped there, and to have said nothing of that event which has created a void in my life which the lapse of two years has done little to fill.

My hand has been forced, however, by the recent letters in which Colonel James Moriarty defends the memory of his brother, and I have no choice but to lay the facts before the public exactly as they occurred.

concepts.comment: force one's hand, figurative, refers to forcing someone to do something

sentences.text: I alone know the absolute truth of the matter, and I am satisfied that the time has come when no good purpose is to be served by its suppression.

As far as I know, there have been only three accounts in the public Press: that in the Journal de Genève upon May 6th, 1891, the Reuter's despatch in the English papers upon May 7th, and finally the recent letters to which I have alluded.

sentences.text: At the age of twenty-one he wrote a treatise upon the Binomial Theorem, which has had a European vogue.

concepts.comment: "At" in this case, is referring to the time in which an event occurs.;

A binomial, like wordnet explains in the 03(1) definition, a polynomial with two terms.

E.g. (a +b).

If (a+b) is multiplied by itself multiple times, the pattern which it follows is summed up and solved by the Binomial Theorem 

Therefore, the definition of "Binomial Theorem" is what people use to solve the problem when the sums get too complicated.;

concepts.comment: adds to degree of description;

Can be understood with an example in Chinese, whereby there is a slight difference between "清楚" (clear understanding) and "无疑" (no doubt). The 'clearly' in this sentence is closer to "he understood it more clearly [than me]" which is "清楚" (clear understanding) instead of "he clearly understood it" which is "无疑" (no doubt). The difference lies in one having a sole subject and the other being a comparison. In this sentence, there is a comparison between Holmes and the narrator "I", whereby there is a focus on who is more understanding of the situation rather than a question of the validity of the situation.

sentences.text: At Canterbury, therefore, we alighted, only to find that we should have to wait an hour before we could get a train to Newhaven.

concepts.comment: Historically and geographically it might matter to the discerning reader to know the exact definition "08883772-n 'a town in Kent in southeastern England'". However, we believe that in the case of a non-native reader or machine, simply tagging 'loc' is more appropriate as it clearly states that the noun is a location. Moreover, when considering the structure of the sentence and the meaningfulness of the word 'Canterbury' in the context of the sentence, the location Canterbury is merely being used as a placeholder to introduce the idea of transit and travel. It is clear to the reader that 'Newhaven' is more important geographically in the sentence as the train incident occurred there. concepts.comment:
I can't really decide between 10162991-n  and 01277426-a .
For 10162991-n, we feel that without a comma after "chief" it is unclear if they are referring to the "terrible chief" of the gang or not. In the Mandarin translation of the story, this lemma is closer.
For 01277426-a, we feel that "chief" could mean the important "few details" of the investigation.
